pageTitle: Patent US5668423 - Exciter for generating vibration in a pager - Google Patents
textBeforeTable: Patent Citations The resultant exciter of this invention employs a blushless type, so that no noise is produced from the exciter. This exciter operates under AC of 1.0 to 220 V and the frequency of the vibration can be easily performed within the scope of 65 to 220 Hz. FIGS. 8A and 8B each shows an exciter having electrode terminals of plate type. This exciter is easily mounted on a main printed circuit board 27 by automatic mounting system. In these figures, reference numeral 29 is a solder. In this figure, the combination structure of the upper housing 35 and the lower housing 34 is somewhat different from that of the first embodiment, and the rotor-receiving space forms a substantially round-shape in the upper and lower housings 34 and 35. The third embodiment employs a structure that the outer guide of the lower housing is broken away and the support strength of each element is increased substantially, while having a simple structure, and simple process is available. This exciter is operated in the same manner with the above-mentioned embodiments. FIG. 7 illustrates a third embodiment of this exciter, where reference numeral 31 is a rotor guide, 32 a rotor, 33 a driving coil, 34 an upper housing, 35 a lower housing, and 36 a rugged type terminal. In the resultant exciter, the upper and lower housings 10 and 12 are made of plastic material having good heat-resistance and
